Tino -

Pranay's suggestions for debuggin this issue were good, and I replied 
separately about the slow-startup-with-long-<job.log> issue.

To address some other issues from your first message:

For now, killing the process is the recommended/only way to completely 
shut down an H3 launch. (There's an outstanding issue to add a web UI 
option.)

I hope that you are using a stronger login combination than your example 
of 'admin:admin', and limiting access to the web UI port by one or both 
of (1) only binding/listening on localhost (the default); (2) other 
network security measures.

The configuration UI of H3 allows reading and writing to arbitrary local 
paths (for configuration editing and file/log browsing) and the 
execution of arbitrary Java code (via scripting in the UI and 
crawl-configuration) -- as the user executing the Java VM. So, you 
should protect access to the H3 user interface as strictly as logins to 
the machine on which it is running. (The web UI can do as much as a 
command shell on the machine.)

- Gordon @ IA

> Look at the heritrix_out.log in $HERITRIX_HOME for some clue.
> I suspect your signal isn't killing all the processes properly. I use

> Did you netstat for the port used by heritrix? I am quite sure, the 
> default port would show up as occupied. Kill that process and you should 
> be good to restart the engine.
